nl.tue.geometrycore.io.raster

Class RasterWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.io.BaseWriter<java.awt.image.BufferedImage,java.awt.Graphics2D>
      • nl.tue.geometrycore.io.raster.RasterWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, GeometryRenderer<java.awt.Graphics2D>

    public class RasterWriter
extends BaseWriter<java.awt.image.BufferedImage,java.awt.Graphics2D>
    Provides a renderer based on the Java2D graphics library. Can be used to render to any Graphics2D object, but is particularly useful to render to a panel, see GeometryPanel, or to render to a bitmap. A BufferedImage may be returned on close, depending on the constructor used.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • graphicsWriter

        public static RasterWriter graphicsWriter(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform worldToView,
                                          int width,
                                          int height,
                                          java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
        Constructs a writer for the provided graphics object, based on a transformation. The provided width and height should match the dimensions of the graphics object. This writer returns null on close.
        Parameters:
        worldToView - transformation from worldspace to viewspace
        width - width of the graphics object
        height - height of the graphics object
        graphics - Java2D graphics object to render to
        Returns:
        new renderer that renders to the provided graphics object

      • graphicsWriter

        public static RasterWriter graphicsWriter(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform worldToView,
                                          int width,
                                          int height,
                                          java.awt.Graphics2D graphics,
                                          java.awt.Color background)
        Constructs a writer for the provided graphics object, based on a transformation. The provided width and height should match the dimensions of the graphics object. This writer returns null on close.
        Parameters:
        worldToView - transformation from worldspace to viewspace
        width - width of the graphics object
        height - height of the graphics object
        graphics - Java2D graphics object to render to
        background - Background color (null for transparent)
        Returns:
        new renderer that renders to the provided graphics object

      • imageWriter

        public static RasterWriter imageWriter(Rectangle worldview,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       java.io.File file)
        Constructs a writer to produce a BufferedImage, which is returned on close. The bitmap is also automatically saved to the provided file. The format depends on the file extension. Supported formats include at least JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP and WBMP, but are system dependent. Run ImageIO.getWriterFormatNames to find out the list of available formats on the JRE.
        Parameters:
        worldview - the area in worldspace to be mapped onto the bitmap
        width - width of the bitmap
        height - height of the bitmap
        file - file to write the bitmap to.
        Returns:
        new renderer to compute the desired bitmap

      • imageWriter

        public static RasterWriter imageWriter(Rectangle worldview,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       java.io.File file,
                                       java.awt.Color background)
        Constructs a writer to produce a BufferedImage, which is returned on close. The bitmap is also automatically saved to the provided file. The format depends on the file extension. Supported formats include at least JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP and WBMP, but are system dependent. Run ImageIO.getWriterFormatNames to find out the list of available formats on the JRE.
        Parameters:
        worldview - the area in worldspace to be mapped onto the bitmap
        width - width of the bitmap
        height - height of the bitmap
        file - file to write the bitmap to.
        background - Background color (null for transparent)
        Returns:
        new renderer to compute the desired bitmap

      • getRenderObject

        public java.awt.Graphics2D getRenderObject()
        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer
        Returns the render object used by this renderer. This object can be used for more customized render handling, but breaks from the genericity of renderers. For advanced use only. May return null.
        Returns:
        object for custom rendering

      • closeWithResult

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage closeWithResult()
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: BaseWriter
        Finalizes the writer, e.g. closing the file or sending its content to the clipboard. This should be the last call made to this object. NB: any other file-specific closing should be handled here. Specific custom closing handlers should be optional.
        Specified by:
        closeWithResult in class BaseWriter<java.awt.image.BufferedImage,java.awt.Graphics2D>
        Returns:
        object that represents the result; this may return null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • pushMatrix

        public void pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform)
        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer
        Applies a transformation matrix to the renderer. Calls to GeometryRenderer.pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and GeometryRenderer.popMatrix(), GeometryRenderer.pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and GeometryRenderer.popClipping(), and GeometryRenderer.pushGroup() and GeometryRenderer.popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • popMatrix

        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer

Calls to GeometryRenderer.pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and GeometryRenderer.popMatrix(), GeometryRenderer.pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and GeometryRenderer.popClipping(), and GeometryRenderer.pushGroup() and GeometryRenderer.popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

Calls to GeometryRenderer.pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and GeometryRenderer.popMatrix(), GeometryRenderer.pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and GeometryRenderer.popClipping(), and GeometryRenderer.pushGroup() and GeometryRenderer.popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer

Calls to GeometryRenderer.pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and GeometryRenderer.popMatrix(), GeometryRenderer.pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and GeometryRenderer.popClipping(), and GeometryRenderer.pushGroup() and GeometryRenderer.popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • pushGroup

        public void pushGroup()
        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer
        Combines all following draw operations into a single group, until GeometryRenderer.popGroup() is called. Calls to GeometryRenderer.pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and GeometryRenderer.popMatrix(), GeometryRenderer.pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and GeometryRenderer.popClipping(), and GeometryRenderer.pushGroup() and GeometryRenderer.popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • popGroup

        public void popGroup()
        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer
        Ends the most recently started group. Calls to GeometryRenderer.pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and GeometryRenderer.popMatrix(), GeometryRenderer.pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and GeometryRenderer.popClipping(), and GeometryRenderer.pushGroup() and GeometryRenderer.popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.
